bindingVersion.title: Anypoint MQ bindings specification version
bindingVersion.description: The version of the Anypoint MQ bindings specification that defines the content of this Binding Object.

proxy.title: HTTP proxy definition
proxy.description: Defines use of a HTTP proxy for interactions with the Anypoint MQ broker.

username.title: Proxy username
username.description: Username to authenticate against the proxy.

password.title: Proxy password
password.description: Password to authenticate against the proxy.

sendBufferSize.title: Size of socket send buffer
sendBufferSize.description: Size of the buffer (in bytes) used when sending data, set on the socket itself.

receiveBufferSize.title: Size of socket receive buffer
receiveBufferSize.description: Size of the buffer (in bytes) used when receiving data.

clientTimeout.title: Socket timeout
clientTimeout.description: SO_TIMEOUT value on sockets. Indicates the amount of time (in milliseconds) that the socket waits in a blocking operation before failing. A value of 0 indicates an indefinite wait.

sendTCPWithNoDelay.title: Send data immediately
sendTCPWithNoDelay.description: If set, transmitted data is not grouped but sent immediately.

linger.title: Socket linger value
linger.description: SO_LINGER value, which determines how long (in milliseconds) the socket takes to close so that any remaining data is transmitted correctly.

keepAlive.title: Keep sockets alive
keepAlive.description: SO_KEEPALIVE behavior on open sockets, which automatically checks open socket connections that are unused for long periods, and closes them if the connection becomes unavailable. This is a property on the socket itself and is used by a server socket to control whether connections to the server are kept alive before they are recycled.

connectionTimeout.title: Socket connection timeout
connectionTimeout.description: Number of milliseconds to wait until an outbound connection to a remote server is successfully created, before failing with a timeout.

specificationExtension.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
